eu.ensg.tsi.azarzelli.gama.generation

Class PerlinNoiseStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.ensg.tsi.azarzelli.gama.generation.PerlinNoiseStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGenerationStrategy

    public final class PerlinNoiseStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGenerationStrategy
    Perlin noise DEM generation. Inspired by: http://flafla2.github.io/2014/08/09/perlinnoise.html https://openclassrooms.com/courses/bruit-de-perlin

    • Field Detail

      • permutation

        private static int[] permutation
        Hash lookup table as defined by Ken Perlin. This is a randomly arranged array of all numbers from 0-255 inclusive.

      • p

        private static int[] p
        Doubled permutation to avoid overflow

        Fills the matrix with Perlin noise generated values

        Parameters:

      • octavePerlinNoise

        private double octavePerlinNoise(double x,
                                 double y)
        Generates a Perlin noise value at (x, y) using several (5) octaves
        Parameters:
        x - column index
        y - row index
        Returns:
        Perlin noise value at (x,y)

      • perlinNoise

        private double perlinNoise(double x,
                           double y)
        Generates a single octave Perlin noise value at (x, y)
        Parameters:
        x - column index
        y - row index
        Returns:
        Perlin noise value at (x,y)

      • fade

        private static double fade(double t)
        Fade function as defined by Ken Perlin. This eases coordinate values so that they will "ease" towards integral values. This ends up smoothing the final output.
        Parameters:
        t - the double value to fade
        Returns:
        6t^5 - 15t^4 + 10t^3

      • lerp

        private static double lerp(double a,
                           double b,
                           double x)
        Linear interpolation of x between a and b .______.___. a x b
        Parameters:
        a - 1st value
        b - 2nd value
        x - the value to interpolate between a and b
        Returns:
        interpolated value
